description:
Note the new location for the meetup - next to Temple Meads Train Station

This week we'll be looking at ClojureScript -

David Nolan has published a draft of the Quick Start for ClojureScript 10:
https://github.com/clojure/clojurescript-site/blob/96cdf27ff1a2a836ae4f7c706e48a0bff21e95a0/content/guides/quick-start.adoc

We'll also look at some of the creative coding work of Karsten Schmidt (https://twitter.com/toxi)

• Further Details - What we'll do - This study group is for people who are want to learn or improve their knowledge of Clojure (https://clojure.org/) and ClojureScript (https://clojurescript.org/)

No prior experience with Clojure, Lisp, functional programming, or coding is required.

All levels of experience is welcome, but for the initial meetings we will be focusing on the basics.

• What to bring
A laptop and an open mind.

It would be helpful if you have Leiningen (https://leiningen.org/) installed and an IDE with a Clojure plugin, though not essential.

• Important to know

Limited Short stay parking is available.

Doors open at 6.30pm. We will be help anyone who needs help with their set up.

We will start at 7pm

Further details on what we will be doing:

Clojure-Study-Group (https://github.com/BristolClojurians/Clojure-Study-Group)
but we are open to new ideas
title: Clojure Study Group
